Elements’ Description:
Operation-name[Required]: Valid value: <operation-name>retrieve-problem</operation-name>
model[Required]: It is the parent tag for containing all other tags.
keys [Required]: used to define the search criteria to fetch the record.
Instance [Required]: It can have many children. The children of this element describe fields of a record.
Id [Optional]: unique id of the problem. Name of this element in the application: Problem ID Valid values: any string.
subcategory [Optional] Name of this element in the application: Problem Detail > Area Valid values: any string.
product-type [Optional] Name of this element in the application: Problem Detail > Subarea Valid values: any string.
problem-type [Optional]: Name of this element in the application: Hidden Valid values: any string.
Initial-impact [Optional]: Name of this element in the application: Problem Detail > Impact Valid values: any string. Existing entries: 1, 2, 3, 4. 1 > Enterprise, 2 > Site/Dept, 3 > Multiple User, 4 > User.
Severity [Optional]: Name of this element in the application: Problem Detail > Urgency Valid values: any string. Existing entries: 1, 2, 3, 4. 1 > critical, 2 > high, 3 > average, 4 > low.
Description [Optional]: Name of this element in the application: Description Valid values: It’s an array type element with each of its element can take String as input.
Assignment [Optional]: Name of this element in the application: Assignment Group Valid values: any valid assignment value
category [Optional]: Name of this element in the application: Hidden. Valid values: any string.
status [Optional]: Name of this element in the application: Hidden. Valid values: any string.
brief-description [Optional]: Name of this element in the application: Title Valid values: any string.
root-cause: Name of this element in the application: Root Cause Description Valid values: any string.
update [Optional]: Name of this element in the application: Activities > Journal Updates Valid values: It's an array type element with each element can have any string value.
open [Optional]: Name of this element in the application: Hidden. Valid values: true or false.
open-time [Optional]: Name of this element in the application: History > Opened (second column 'At') Valid values: any input in date time format.
Opened-by [Optional]: Name of this element in the application: History > Opened (first column 'By') Valid values: any string.
update-time [Optional]: Name of this element in the application: History > Last Updated (second column 'At') Valid values: any input of date time format.
updated-by [Optional]: Name of this element in the application: History > Last Updated (first column 'By') Valid values: any string.
close-time [Optional]: Name of this element in the application: History > Closed (second column 'At') Valid values: any input in date time format.
Closed-by [Optional]: Name of this element in the application: History > Closed (first column 'By') Valid values: any string.
reopen-time [Optional]: Name of this element in the application: History > Re-Opened (second column 'At') Valid values: any input in date time format.
Reopened-by [Optional]: Name of this element in the application: History > Re-Opened (first column 'By') Valid values: any string.
Priority-code [Optional]: Name of this element in the application: Problem Detail > Priority. Valid values: any string.
sysmodtime [Optional]: Name of this element in the application: Hidden. Valid values: any input in date time format.
Sysmodcount [Optional]: Name of this element in the application: Hidden. Valid values: any decimal.
sysmoduser [Optional]: Name of this element in the application: Hidden. Valid values: any string.
assignee-name [Optional]: Name of this element in the application: Problem Coordinator Valid values: Any string.
work-around [Optional]: Name of this element in the application: Suggested Workaround Valid values: it's an array type element with each of its element of string type.
affected-item [Optional]: Name of this element in the application: Service Valid values : any valid Service value in Affected Items category

Provide username/password in form of xml.
This input parameter is required when the user wants to override the default values for username and password provided in the adapter configuration. This is required for cases where an operation cannot be executed with the default username/password provided in the adapter configuration and only user with special permissions can execute the operation. Examples of such operations can be - 'approve-change', 'deny-change', 'close-change', 'approve-task'
Sample XML Format:
<connection-parameters> <alternate-username>USERNAME</alternate-username> <alternate-password>PASSWORD</alternate-password> </connection-parameters>

output.description: The adapter response containing the results.
